name: Whitechapel
description: '''Whitechapel''' is an American [[deathcore]] band from [[Knoxville, Tennessee]]. The band is named after the [[Whitechapel]] district in [[east London]], England, where [[Jack the Ripper]] committed a [[Whitechapel murders|series of murders]]. The group comprises vocalist Phil Bozeman, guitarists Ben Savage, Alex Wade, and Zach Householder, bassist Gabe Crisp and drummer Brandon Zackey. Their core lineup, with the exception of the drummer, has remained consistent since Householder replaced original guitarist Brandon Cagle in 2007. Founded in 2006 by Bozeman and Savage, the band has released nine studio albums and twenty-two music videos, and is currently signed to [[Metal Blade Records]]. Whitechapel's 2010 album ''[[A New Era of Corruption]]'', sold around 10,600 copies in the United States in its first week of release and debuted at position No. 43 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart. The band's [[Whitechapel (album)|self-titled fourth album]] was released in 2012 and debuted at No. 47 on the Billboard 200, selling roughly 9,200 copies in its first week. In 2014 the band released their fifth full-length album, ''[[Our Endless War]]'' to generally positive reviews. The album sold roughly 16,000 copies in its first week and debuted at No. 10 on the Billboard 200. They released their sixth full-length album ''[[Mark of the Blade]]'' in 2016 to greater critical acclaim, selling roughly 8,000 copies in the first week of its release. In 2019, Whitechapel released their seventh album, ''[[The Valley (Whitechapel album)|The Valley]]'', which debuted at No. 143 on the Billboard 200 also to critical acclaim. Their newest album, ''[[Hymns in Dissonance]]'', was released on March 7, 2025.
